{"step_by_step_thinking": "The external carotid artery is a major blood vessel that supplies blood to the face, scalp, and neck. It gives rise to several branches. To determine which of the options is not a branch of the external carotid artery, we need to identify the branches of the external carotid artery and compare them to the given options. The branches of the external carotid artery include the posterior auricular artery, occipital artery, maxillary artery, and ophthalmic artery. We need to identify the option that is not a branch of the external carotid artery.", "answer_choice": "D"}
